text: The 2019 Idaho Vandals football team represented the University of Idaho in the 2019 NCAA Division I FCS football season. The Vandals played their home games on campus at the Kibbie Dome in Moscow, Idaho, and were members of the Big Sky Conference. They were led by seventh-year head coach Paul Petrino."Vandals to Host EWU in 2019, Season Tickets on Sale", govandals.com, January 11, 2019, retrieved April 2, 2019."2019 Idaho Roster", govandals.com, March 6, 2019. They finished the season 5–7, 3–5 in Big Sky play to finish in a three-way tie for sixth place. == Previous season == The Vandals finished the 2018 season 4–7, 3–5 in Big Sky Conference."Season Ends in Loss at Florida", govandals.com, November 17, 2018, retrieved April 2, 2019. ==Preseason== ===Big Sky preseason poll=== The Big Sky released their preseason media and coaches' polls on July 15, 2019. align="center" | 16–4 | 1995 | IDA, 17–14 |} ==Ranking movements== ==NFL Draft== No Vandals were selected in the 2020 NFL Draft. Jake Luton of Oregon State, a Vandal quarterback as a redshirt freshman in 2015, was taken by the Jacksonville Jaguars in the sixth round, 189th overall. *List of Idaho Vandals in the NFL Draft ==References== Idaho Category:Idaho Vandals football seasons Idaho Vandals football
